UI_visible_response: Read 11 web pagesView Page Details"Under the Dome" can refer to different works:Novel"Under the Dome" is a science fiction novel written by Stephen King and published in 2009. It tells the story of the residents of the fictional small town of Chester's Mill, Maine, who are suddenly enclosed by a massive, transparent, and indestructible dome. The novel explores themes such as corruption and control, prophecy and premonition, and the dissolution of democracy. It also has environmental and political undertones, reflecting on serious ecological problems and criticizing certain political incompetency.TV Series"Under the Dome" is also an American science fiction horror mystery drama television series that aired on CBS from June 24, 2013, to September 10, 2015. The series was developed by Brian K. Vaughan and was loosely based on Stephen King's novel. It follows the same basic premise of the novel, with the residents of Chester's Mill trapped under the dome, struggling to survive with diminishing resources and rising tensions. The TV adaptation received generally favorable reviews for its first season, with praise for its airtight plotting and special effects.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: "Under the Dome" can refer to different works:### Novel"Under the Dome" is a science fiction novel written by Stephen King and published in 2009[^1^]. It tells the story of the residents of the fictional small town of Chester's Mill, Maine, who are suddenly enclosed by a massive, transparent, and indestructible dome[^3^]. The novel explores themes such as corruption and control, prophecy and premonition, and the dissolution of democracy[^5^]. It also has environmental and political undertones, reflecting on serious ecological problems and criticizing certain political incompetency[^3^].### TV Series"Under the Dome" is also an American science fiction horror mystery drama television series that aired on CBS from June 24, 2013, to September 10, 2015[^2^]. The series was developed by Brian K. Vaughan and was loosely based on Stephen King's novel[^2^]. It follows the same basic premise of the novel, with the residents of Chester's Mill trapped under the dome, struggling to survive with diminishing resources and rising tensions[^2^]. The TV adaptation received generally favorable reviews for its first season, with praise for its airtight plotting and special effects[^2^].
